title: Permanent Residency in Canada: How can a married couple apply for Canada PR? - Quora

response.answer_text: Assuming that you both are in early 30s and graduates with more than 6 years work experience in the respective NOC. Get your educational credentials assessed by WES and (both PA & Spouse) appear for IELTS and obtain 6.5 minimum in each module. The more you score in IELTS, more will be your CRS score. Once both the above got done and you’ve the Certificates in hand, you (Spouse having highest points can be PA) can register yourself into Express Entry pool. If your CRS score is more than 440-450, you are surely to be picked up by CIC in their draws which is being held twice a month. Once you are invited, you have 60 days to submit your application for Canadian PR. If your CRS score is less than 440, look for the options of provincial nominations as it will fetch you additional 600 points. Before you start all these process, go to Google and type CRS score calculator and you can find out what will be your approximate CRS score.
Visa Point Calculator Its no different from individual applying, its just that you will have benefits like spouse points etc which you will clearly follow once you use the above site.
